tests.name: A: Compilation
tests.run: cd A; make

tests.name: A: ./problemA test-files/test-1-in.txt 4 (Number of threads)
tests.run: cd A; ./problemA test-files/test-1-in.txt 4 >test-files/out.txt 2>test-files/err.txt; [ $(awk '{print $1}' test-files/err.txt | uniq | wc -l) -eq 4 ];

tests.name: A: ./problemA test-files/test-1-in.txt 4 (Per-thread sum size)
tests.run: cd A; ./problemA test-files/test-1-in.txt 4 >test-files/out.txt 2>test-files/err.txt; [ $(awk '{print $2}' test-files/err.txt | uniq) == 3 ];

tests.name: A: ./problemA test-files/test-1-in.txt 4 (Output)
tests.run: cd A; ./problemA test-files/test-1-in.txt 4 >test-files/out.txt 2>test-files/err.txt; diff -q test-files/out.txt test-files/test-1-out.txt &>/dev/null;

tests.name: A: ./problemA test-files/test-2-in.txt 10 (Number of threads)
tests.run: cd A; ./problemA test-files/test-2-in.txt 10 >test-files/out.txt 2>test-files/err.txt; [ $(awk '{print $1}' test-files/err.txt | uniq | wc -l) -eq 10 ];

tests.name: A: ./problemA test-files/test-2-in.txt 10 (Per-thread sum size)
tests.run: cd A; ./problemA test-files/test-2-in.txt 10 >test-files/out.txt 2>test-files/err.txt; [ $(awk '{print $2}' test-files/err.txt | uniq) == 50 ];

tests.name: A: ./problemA test-files/test-2-in.txt 10 (Output)
tests.run: cd A; ./problemA test-files/test-2-in.txt 10 >test-files/out.txt 2>test-files/err.txt; diff -q test-files/out.txt test-files/test-2-out.txt &>/dev/null;

tests.name: A: ./problemA test-files/test-3-in.txt 100 (Number of threads)
tests.run: cd A; ./problemA test-files/test-3-in.txt 100 >test-files/out.txt 2>test-files/err.txt; [ $(awk '{print $1}' test-files/err.txt | uniq | wc -l) -eq 100 ];

tests.name: A: ./problemA test-files/test-3-in.txt 100 (Per-thread sum size)
tests.run: cd A; ./problemA test-files/test-3-in.txt 100 >test-files/out.txt 2>test-files/err.txt; [ $(awk '{print $2}' test-files/err.txt | uniq) == 4 ];

tests.name: A: ./problemA test-files/test-3-in.txt 100 (Output)
tests.run: cd A; ./problemA test-files/test-3-in.txt 100 >test-files/out.txt 2>test-files/err.txt; diff -q test-files/out.txt test-files/test-3-out.txt &>/dev/null;

tests.name: B: Compilation
tests.run: cd B; make

tests.name: B: ./problemB 2 <test-files/test-1-in.txt (Number of threads)
tests.run: cd B; ./problemB 2 <test-files/test-1-in.txt >test-files/out.txt 2>test-files/err.txt; [ $(awk '{print $1}' test-files/out.txt | sort | uniq | wc -l) -eq 2 ];

tests.name: B: ./problemB 2 <test-files/test-1-in.txt (Output)
tests.run: cd B; ./problemB 2 <test-files/test-1-in.txt >test-files/out.txt 2>test-files/err.txt; awk '{print $2}' test-files/out.txt > test-files/tmp.txt; diff -q test-files/tmp.txt test-files/test-1-in.txt &>/dev/null;

tests.name: B: ./problemB 2 <test-files/test-1-in.txt (Consumer trace)
tests.run: cd B; ./problemB 2 <test-files/test-1-in.txt >test-files/out.txt 2>test-files/err.txt; diff -q test-files/err.txt test-files/test-1-err.txt &>/dev/null;

tests.name: B: ./problemB 4 <test-files/test-2-in.txt (Number of threads)
tests.run: cd B; ./problemB 4 <test-files/test-2-in.txt >test-files/out.txt 2>test-files/err.txt; [ $(awk '{print $2}' test-files/out.txt | sort | uniq | wc -l) -eq 4 ];

tests.name: B: ./problemB 4 <test-files/test-2-in.txt (Output)
tests.run: cd B; ./problemB 4 <test-files/test-2-in.txt >test-files/out.txt 2>test-files/err.txt; awk '{print $2}' test-files/out.txt > test-files/tmp.txt; diff -q test-files/tmp.txt test-files/test-2-in.txt &>/dev/null;

tests.name: B: ./problemB 4 <test-files/test-2-in.txt (Consumer trace)
tests.run: cd B; ./problemB 4 <test-files/test-2-in.txt >test-files/out.txt 2>test-files/err.txt; diff -q test-files/err.txt test-files/test-2-err.txt &>/dev/null;

tests.name: B: ./problemB 10 <test-files/test-3-in.txt (Number of threads)
tests.run: cd B; ./problemB 10 <test-files/test-3-in.txt >test-files/out.txt 2>test-files/err.txt; [ $(awk '{print $1}' test-files/out.txt | sort | uniq | wc -l) -eq 10 ];

tests.name: B: ./problemB 10 <test-files/test-3-in.txt (Output)
tests.run: cd B; ./problemB 10 <test-files/test-3-in.txt >test-files/out.txt 2>test-files/err.txt; awk '{print $2}' test-files/out.txt > test-files/tmp.txt; diff -q test-files/tmp.txt test-files/test-3-in.txt &>/dev/null;

tests.name: B: ./problemB 10 <test-files/test-3-in.txt (Consumer trace)
tests.run: cd B; ./problemB 10 <test-files/test-3-in.txt >test-files/out.txt 2>test-files/err.txt; diff -q test-files/err.txt test-files/test-3-err.txt &>/dev/null;

tests.name: C: Compilation
tests.run: cd C; make

tests.name: C: ?
tests.run: cd C;
